edu.uwa.aidan.robot.world
Class GoalSensor

java.lang.Object
  edu.uwa.aidan.robot.world.GoalSensor

public class GoalSensor
extends java.lang.Object

A GoalSensor is a simple sensor that is either on or off, depending on if the Goal lies between it's angles (which are related to the rotation of the Robot). There are typically four GoalSensors attached to a Robot, and only one of them may be active at any time. A GoalSensor effectively creates a large arc, which is then tested to determine if the Goal lies somewhere inside that arc. The GoalSensor is static relative to the Robot, however when evaluating whether the Goal lies inside it's range, the current rotation of the Robot must also be taken into account. The GoalSensor is not impeded by the presence of any Obstacles.

Author:
Aidan Morgan

Constructor Detail

GoalSensor

public GoalSensor(Robot agent,
                  int index,
                  double startAngle,
                  double endAngle)
Constructor.

Parameters:
agent - the Robot that this GoalSensor belongs to.
index - the index at which this GoalSensor is in the Robots sensor suite.
startAngle - the starting angle (static in comparison to the robot) of this GoalSensor's sweep range.
endAngle - the ending angle (static in comparison to the robot) of this GoalSensor's sweep range.
Method Detail

getX

public double getX(double angle)
Determines a x coordinate based on the Robots current position, as well as it's current rotation, and using the SENSOR_RANGE. This is used to determine the x coordinates of the boundaries of the sensor's sweep.

Parameters:
angle - the angle from the Robot's forward direction that this x coordinate is to be calculated from.
Returns:
the x coordinate, SENSOR_RANGE units away, at the angle from the Robot's current rotation.

getY

public double getY(double angle)
Determines a y coordinate based on the Robots current position, as well as it's current rotation, and using the SENSOR_RANGE. This is used to determine the y coordinates of the boundaries of the sensor's sweep.

Parameters:
angle - the angle from the Robot's forward direction that this y coordinate is to be calculated from.
Returns:
the y coordinate, SENSOR_RANGE units away, at the angle from the Robot's current rotation.

containsGoal

public boolean containsGoal()
Returns true if the Goal is inside this GoalSensor, false otherwise.

Returns:
true if the Goal is inside this GoalSensor, false otherwise.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                  double pixelRatio)
Used to render this GoalSensor to the Graphics2D instance, using the provided aspect ratio.

Parameters:
g2d - the Graphics2D instance for rendering with,
pixelRatio - the aspect ratio to use for rendering.
